snippet: The so-called jock tax, which charged athletes up to $7,500 per year for playing games in Tennessee, was the only one of its kind that charged a flat fee, regardless of an athlete’s salary.
abstract: Lawmakers in Tennessee vote to repeal state’s so-called jock tax, which charges opposing professional athletes a tax when they visit for games.
lead_paragraph: The so-called jock tax, which charged athletes up to $7,500 per year for playing games in Tennessee, was the only one of its kind that charged a flat fee, regardless of an athlete’s salary.

headline.main: Tennessee Votes to Eliminate Special Tax for Professional Athletes
